I have to approve... You don't know how many such threat letters come
and go, it's just plain amazing! I should have been six feet under for
years now!

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> Oh, for the love of ... I won't say it.
> 
> What the hell, I will anyway:
> 
> I can't believe people are so stupid, so utterly devoid of 
> intelligence, that they'll believe the total bullshit they find in 
> these chain letters.
> 
> CASE 1:
> 
> Cardhead opens his mailbox, finding a chain letter that 
> promises "luck", something that doesn't exist other than as part of 
> superstition.  Cardhead deletes the message without even reading the 
> entire intro, let alone the message itself.  Weeks pass and nothing, 
> repeat NOTHING, happens.  Situation repeats every now and again, as 
> online contacts fall for the same old "true story" approach.  CASE 
> CLOSED.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> > A somewhat silly way to get out of it I know, but hey
> > I don't wanna' get hit by a hit and run driver, and I
> > don't HAVE the e-mail address of 10 friends not on
> > this site (I could probably scrong up 3 or 4).
> > 
> > Note: forwarded message attached.
> >
